title: Suggestion for E0759 can fail to compile when encountered in a trait method

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
Given the following code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=62ad5a6067f737f4434bfd3051572b1d)):

```rust
use std::io::Read;

trait FileSystem {
    fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read>;
}

impl FileSystem for [u8] {
    fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read> {
        Box::new(self)
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0759]: `self` has an anonymous lifetime `'_` but it needs to satisfy a `'static` lifetime requirement
 --> src/lib.rs:9:18
  |
8 |     fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read> {
  |             ----- this data with an anonymous lifetime `'_`...
9 |         Box::new(self)
  |                  ^^^^ ...is used and required to live as long as `'static` here
  |
note: `'static` lifetime requirement introduced by the return type
 --> src/lib.rs:8:27
  |
8 |     fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read> {
  |                           ^^^^^^^^ `'static` requirement introduced here
9 |         Box::new(self)
  |         -------------- because of this returned expression
help: to declare that the trait object captures data from argument `self`, you can add an explicit `'_` lifetime bound
  |
8 |     fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read + '_> {
  |                                    ++++
```

The suggested change still does not compile since the signature for `read` no longer matches the trait definition ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=e912705d61505577bc90fa47a4a66b33)):
```
error: `impl` item signature doesn't match `trait` item signature
 --> src/lib.rs:8:5
  |
4 |     fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read>;
  |     -------------------------------- expected `fn(&'1 [u8]) -> Box<(dyn std::io::Read + 'static)>`
...
8 |     fn open(&self) -> Box<dyn Read + '_> {
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ found `fn(&'1 [u8]) -> Box<(dyn std::io::Read + '1)>`
  |
  = note: expected `fn(&'1 [u8]) -> Box<(dyn std::io::Read + 'static)>`
             found `fn(&'1 [u8]) -> Box<(dyn std::io::Read + '1)>`
  = help: the lifetime requirements from the `impl` do not correspond to the requirements in the `trait`
  = help: verify the lifetime relationships in the `trait` and `impl` between the `self` argument, the other inputs and its output
```

Ideally, this suggestion should not be made.

@rustbot modify labels: +A-lifetimes +A-suggestion-diagnostics +A-traits +D-invalid-suggestion
